reviewText: Richard is, as always, energetic and encouraging in this workout DVD and it is fast paced.  It is a good workout but there are alot of changes during the routines.  I wish there was a bit more repitition versus the quick changes that take place.  Once you get the hang of it though, it is a good work out.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I don't know how he keeps coming up with new moves, but Richard does.This tape is good for beginners on up.  The moves do not get boring like in beginner tapes from other teachers.  Richard's upbeat approach is as evident as ever. We love you.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of my favorite Richard Simmons DVDs.  It lasts about 50 minutes, about 45 minutes of which is aerobics/dance.  The songs are from the 80s.  I could have done without Like a Virgin, though the rest of them were good.  One thing I like about Richard is that he doesn't teach the steps.  So at first, it takes a bit of time to get things figured out.  But in the long run it's so much nicer to not have to "review" the steps every time you use the DVD.  This is a pretty good workout; I always break a sweat early on.  Beginners can modify the steps or arm movements if they want.  I added wrist weights today to get a more intense workout.  One thing I love about Richard Simmons is that he makes exercising fun.  I don't like to exercise, but I do because I need to.  Once I start a Richard Simmons DVD I get into it right away.  Richard is encouraging and he surrounds himself with ordinary people wearing pretty much ordinary clothes.

reviewText: This workout is really great. It is not even a workout. You will feel like you are having a dance-party. I love this workout.

reviewText: I just recently purchased a couple of Richard Simmons video, as I really do need to lose some weight...This video, is very fun and the music is also fun. This DVD really caught my attention when I played it and I feel that I will get much use out of this one. The music is very fun and it is more like clubbing than exercising! Way to go Richard, I love it!You can't go wrong with this one!
summary: This is one of Richard's best workout videos!

reviewText: this workout is great! it is fast-paced. if you have sweatin' to the oldies 1-4, then you know that 1&2 are a little slower, 3&4 are faster. this one is much like sweatin' 3&4. if you are used to those, this is similar, with awesome 80's music! enjoy! =)

reviewText: I love this new exercise DVD of Richard Simmon's!  He is so motivational and this one really keeps the heart rate up without being hard to do.  I have just about every exercise video he has put out and each one gets even better!  I have fibromyalgia and chronic myofascial pain, yet am able to do his tapes!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is my first Richard Simmons DVD. This may sound bad but I mean no disrespect. I had always passed over Richard Simmons because I thought he was just for the very large or very out of shape. I am neither. I am thin for my height and am in pretty good shape. I was looking for something new though and I decided to try it. I love the music and with some moderations (bouncing jumping jacks instead of just keeping the feet low for example) this workout became the best I have done. It kicked on the Crunch series for making me sweat. I really love it except Richard gets a little annoying, I just find him slimey. I also am not a fan of the costumed dancers except maybe the cheerleaders in Mickey, the girls in the dresses dancing in the one song I can't even watch as Richard "meows" at one of them and I just can't handle that. Overall though, I would recommend it, I am getting another one of his DVDs to do.
Title: N/A
